Hello Remote Parents and Students,

Thank you for a wonderful start to the new school year!
We recognize that learning in a remote environment is a new normal for some of you. We realize that you may have been experiencing problems with videos playing inside of Google Classroom. This is a problem that is easily fixed by following these steps on your Chromebook.

1. Click on the video assigned.
2. Click on the 'play' button in the center of the video. IF it does not work or does not play, then move your cursor to the top of the screen on the upper right-hand corner. Click on the download button. (This is a small icon with an arrow pointing down)
3. This will begin to download to the bottom of the screen.
4. After finished, you will need to click "Show In Folder."
5. Find your video and play it.

We are confident that once your child is shown how to download the videos, they will become instant pros!

As always, if you are experiencing technical difficulties contact your child's school.

As per Governor DeWine's March 30th order, we will be closed until May 1. Stay tuned for updates on how we will be proceeding forward with remote instruction in the coming weeks.

Please continue to work on instructional packs provided to your children for the weeks of March 16-April 3. This was our first phase of instruction. We are working on a plan where paper packets can be returned to school in a safe manner in the coming weeks. The next "phase" of instruction will continue to build on those packets and introduce new instruction to begin the new grading period.

We will continue to blend online and paper copies of materials to offer the best we can to our students during this tumultuous time.

Please be checking your emails and encourage your children to be checking their emails for instructions from their teachers.

As always, if you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to your child's teacher. Their email format is as follows: firstname.lastname@rvbears.org.

We regret to inform all of our coaches and teams that beginning Monday, March 16th, all of our sports practices, music practices, play rehearsals and performances, and competitions will be suspended until we are permitted to return to school. This is happening all through the area and seems to be the direction most districts are taking. Again, we are terribly sorry as we know that our kids have worked very hard, as well as the planning and work put into these programs by our coaches, advisors, and directors. As our Governor has stated, we are in a time of unprecedented reality. We are all going to have to work together for the greater good to do our part, and this is the unfortunate act we are going to have to take.

Dalton Summers,
Superintendent of River View Local Schools

post_text: Math time gets real at Conesville Elementary! Way to go cubs! #GOODSUFF #GoBears
shared_text:
Conesville Class of 2032
February 5 at 8:28 PM ·

Math Time! We LOVE the way we do Math in Kindergarten! Even though we have 58 Kindergarteners, we have 6 Math Teams with around 10 kids in each group (those who work quicker may have more, and those who need more support have less than 10), which makes for better learning opportunities for our students! Here is one of the groups breaking apart 8 into different parts and writing number sentences to match!

For those wondering how we do this:
We have 3 teachers with each teacher working with 2 groups. When kids are not working with the teacher they rotate with fluency practice with a parapro and number practice using an online program (working on number sense and other math concepts at their personal level!).
